isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER, GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - 9800 - OPERATION - WARNING LIGHTS, INDICATOR LIGHTS AND ALARMS (Figure 1)

svcproc.title: WARNING LIGHTS, INDICATOR LIGHTS AND ALARMS ( Figure 1)

svcsubproc.title: Oil/Water Warning Light
svcsubproc.para: This yellow light is located in the right gauge cluster and is only used when the Cummins M11, N14 or ISM engine is installed in the 9800. The light is part of the engine protection system. It warns when the following systems are out of preset levels:
The light will come on at the occurrence and then begin blinking to warn that the condition has been active for a period of time or the condition has become worse.

svcsubproc.title: "Engine Warn" Warning Light
svcsubproc.para: This yellow light is located in the right gauge cluster and is part of the engine protection system.

When a Cummins M11, N14 or ISM engine is installed in the 9800, this light indicates an active component or system failure. This light indicates a failure has happened, and the vehicle can still be operated safely.
When a Detroit Diesel Series 60 DDEC III engine is installed in the 9800, the light warns when the following systems are out of preset levels:

svcsubproc.title: "Engine Stop" Warning Light
svcsubproc.para: This red light is located in the right gauge cluster and is part of the engine protection system. This light indicates a major system problem and the vehicle should be stopped and engine shut down as soon as is safely possible.

caution.para: Failure to follow the "engine warn" and "engine stop" lights could cause serious damage or catastrophic failure of the engine.

svcsubproc.title: Low Air Pressure Warning Light and Alarm
svcsubproc.para: When the vehicle air system pressure is below 76 psi, the low air pressure warning system activates, turning ON the warning light and causing the alarm to sound continuously. This system includes the warning light located in the right gauge cluster, two low air pressure switches (one in the primary system and one in the secondary system), and the alarm that is located in the power distribution center.

svcsubproc.title: Power Divider Lock (PDL) Warning Light and Buzzer
svcsubproc.para: When the power divider lockout switch is engaged, the normally open switch is closed. This completes the ground path and turns the warning light and warning buzzer on. The light is located on the left gauge cluster.

svcsubproc.title: Air Suspension Release Warning Light
svcsubproc.para: This warning light is located in the right gauge cluster. It illuminates when the tractor air suspension is being dumped to the atmosphere. It will stay lit until the suspension is charged to its operating pressure.

svcsubproc.title: ABS Warning Light
svcsubproc.para: This yellow light is located between the right gauge cluster and the wing panel. It indicates when the antilock brake system is activated.

On Bendix systems the ABS warning light will be illuminated at engine start-up for approximately two seconds and then extinguish after a successful self test of the electrical system. If an error is detected at any time, the dash light will stay illuminated.

On Wabco systems, when the controller is initially put into service, or each time the controller is serviced (fault codes cleared using an electronic service tool or the blink light switch), the vehicle must be driven above 4 mph to extinguish the ABS dash warning light. Once the ABS dash warning light is extinguished, the ABS dash warning light will function in the same manner as the Bendix ABS dash warning light previously mentioned.

note.para: If an antilock fault develops, standard air brake system operation is maintained. The brake system is still operational, but the antilock system will not operate to prevent wheel lockup if the driver over-applies the brakes for existing conditions.

svcsubproc.title: Traction Control Warning Light
svcsubproc.para: This yellow light is located between the right gauge cluster and the wing panel. It indicates when the traction control system is activated. If wheel spin occurs during operation, the light will blink.
At start-up the light will flash and then go out. If the light does not come on, does not flash, or fails to go out, the traction control system is inoperative.

svcsubproc.title: Transmission Service Warning Light
svcsubproc.para: This yellow light is located between the right gauge cluster and the wing panel. It indicates when an error has been detected by the transmission computer.

At start-up the light will come on and then go out. This indicates that the self-diagnostic test was successful and the lamp is working. If the light comes on at any other time, there is a problem with the transmission.

svcsubproc.title: Hi-Beam, Turn Signals and Flashers
svcsubproc.para: The Hi-beam, turn signal and flasher lights alert the driver when these systems are activated.

svcsubproc.title: Rear Light Warning Light
svcsubproc.para: The rear light warning light illuminates when the fifth wheel work light is on.
